author: Special Correspondent
text:
The strike call given by All India Bank Employees’ Association partially affected banking operations in the city and suburbs on Friday.

According to the agitators, the strike was called to protest the implementation of career progression scheme by five associate banks of State Bank of India — State Bank of Mysore, State Bank of Patiala, State Bank of Bikaner and Jaipur, State Bank of Hyderabad and State Bank of Travancore.

The protestors said that the scheme affected the employees’ career progression and repeated pleas to rectify the anomalies were not accepted. Over 500 employees affiliated to the association took part in the strike. It was felt that the strike would affect the customers as it would be holiday for the next two days – the second Saturday is a holiday. Cheque transactions were affected and it was apprehended that some ATMs may go dry due to the long weekend.
title: Stir hits banking transactions
